sentences.english: Eric Suen Yiu Wai and Chan Fa La felt embarrassed when they were playing heartbeat measurement.
sentences.chinese: 孙耀威和陈法拉玩量度心跳，都感尴尬。
用掉是另一个尴尬的用词。

sentences.english: Natives will cringe and squirm with embarrassment at such brashness.
sentences.chinese: 对于这种轻率鲁莽，当地人会因尴尬而战战兢兢。

sentences.english: Madam Michel found her in an awkward position.
sentences.chinese: 米雪女士发现自己处于一个尴尬的境地。

sentences.english: Those people are always awkward in society.
sentences.chinese: 这些人在社交界总是很尴尬。

sentences.english: He vacillates from agile, amiable, and arch to repetitive and awkward.
sentences.chinese: 他摇摆不定的敏捷，和蔼可亲，并拱重复和尴尬。

sentences.english: As an argument broke out in Chinese, we felt unbelievably awkward.
sentences.chinese: 一场中国话的争吵爆发时，我们感到难以置信的尴尬。

sentences.english: To mother's facial expression mortified, lower the brain.
sentences.chinese: 向妈妈脸色尴尬，低下头去。

sentences.english: He dealed with an embarrassed situation dexterously.
sentences.chinese: 他很巧妙地应付了一个尴尬局面。

sentences.english: The embarrassment for the government-and the delight of everybody else-remained.
sentences.chinese: 所以政府的尴尬和人们的喜悦互相对峙。

sentences.english: Parents were too shy to tackle embarrassing issues such as sex head-on.
sentences.chinese: 家长羞于跟孩子正面讨论诸如性这样的尴尬问题。

sentences.english: The Qiao son sees him not to talk, likewise feel that having a mini is mortified.
sentences.chinese: 巧儿见他不说话，也觉得有点尴尬了。

sentences.english: Hearing what Xu You said, he suddenly felt embarrassed and at a loss.
sentences.chinese: 意而子听许由这么说，顿时觉得尴尬而不知所措。

sentences.english: I felt awkward as everyone except me was in evening dress.
sentences.chinese: 我感到很尴尬，因为除了我，谁都是穿上了夜礼服的。

sentences.english: It was embarrassing for him to bump into one of his ex- girlfriends last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨天晚上撞见其中一个前女友真是让他尴尬。

sentences.english: Water to the Soviet Union in the region south of the water culture in an awkward position.
sentences.chinese: 江南的多水也使苏中地区的水源文化处于尴尬的境地。

definition: to feel embarrassed/to find it embarrassing/to be sorry (for inconveniencing sb)
helpless/without choice/for lack of better option/grudgingly/willy-nilly/nolens volens/abbr. for 無可奈何|无可奈何[wu2 ke3 nai4 he2]
(Internet slang) awkward conversation/to have a cringeworthy conversation
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
hard to explain in a few words (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly
